benchmark_details.name: LoCoV1 (Long-Context Retrieval Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: LoCoV1 is a novel benchmark consisting of 12 tasks drawn from law, medicine, science, finance, corporate governance, government reports, and more, designed to measure long-context retrieval performance. It evaluates systems that need to process documents of up to 32K tokens, emphasizing reasoning across long spans of text.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to establish a reliable evaluation framework for long-context retrieval tasks in machine learning.

data.source: The benchmark draws tasks from real-world datasets spanning diverse domains including Tau Scrolls, QASPER, LongBench, and the Legal Case Reports corpus.
data.size: 12 tasks with varying numbers of queries and documents

methodology.calculation: nDCG@10 is calculated based on the ranking quality of the retrieval systems.
methodology.interpretation: Higher nDCG@10 scores indicate better performance in returning relevant documents for given queries.
methodology.baseline_results: M2-BERT achieves significantly higher scores compared to existing retrieval models, validating its effectiveness on the LoCoV1 benchmark.
methodology.validation: Performance validation through comparative analysis with existing state-of-the-art models.

harm: Potential for models to reinforce existing biases present in training data.
